alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Howard (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 5:59PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Greeley, east central Sherman and northwestern Howard Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 559 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Scotia to Cotesfield to Ashton. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cotesfield around 605 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Greeley, Farwell, Elba and Wolbach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
